item.title: The Future of Lodash
item.description: Lodash begins a new stage with a more collaborative and sustainable model. This post outlines the plan to simplify its maintenance, strengthen security, and ensure its key role in the JavaScript ecosystem for the coming years.

item.title: The best thing I learned this year · hidden.computer
item.description: I am ecstatic. Elated. Over the moon. Positively glowing. I've learned something that makes me happy and turns a previously dreadful task into an absolute joy and a satisfying one at that. I am going to share this joyful knowledge with you. Are you ready to learn about provisioning TLS certificates for internal networks using split horizon DNS, ACME, and Caddy?

item.title: Announcing the Swift SDK for Android
item.description: Swift has matured significantly over the past decade — extending from cloud services to Windows applications, browser apps, and microcontrollers. Swift powers apps and services of all kinds, and thanks to its great interoperability, you can share code across platforms.

item.description: The Asahi Linux developers involved with working on Linux support for Apple Silicon M-Series devices have put out a new progress report on their development efforts.

item.title: Why CIELAB doesn’t improve median cut
item.description: Color quantization is a process that compresses an image into a color table, or a palette, and an index image that references the palette. The process can be divided into a palette design phase that analyzes an image, followed by a pixel mapping phase that assigns a palette color to each original image pixel.

item.title: Computer Science Courses that Don't Exist, But Should
item.description: CSCI 2100: Unlearning Object-Oriented Programming Discover how to create and use variables that aren't inside of an object hierarchy. Learn about "functions," which are like methods but more generally useful. Prerequisite: Any course that used the term "abstract base class."
